issue.title: [C++] Add a 'choose' kernel/scalar compute function
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-13220](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-13220). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
Emulate SQL's choose or (a very limited subset of) NumPy's choose.

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-13220?focusedCommentId=17373328) by Joris Van den Bossche (jorisvandenbossche):*
Linking ARROW-10640 which also had some discussion on the "choose" topic (vs "select/case_when")

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-13220?focusedCommentId=17382638) by Ian Cook (icook):*
For the R bindings: I'm not aware of any existing R function that we should bind to this. `[~jonkeane]`  can you think of any?

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-13220?focusedCommentId=17382652) by Jonathan Keane (jonkeane):*
I can't think of anything that does something like this in R to bind to either.
